description: An island in the West Blue famous for its scholars and the Tree of Knowledge. Destroyed by a Buster Call ordered by the World Government after its scholars researched the Void Century.

keyEvents.title: Buster Call Activated on Ohara
keyEvents.description: Spandine activates the Golden Den Den Mushi, summoning the Buster Call to completely destroy Ohara and everyone on it.
keyEvents.significance: The beginning of Ohara's complete destruction, one of the most tragic events in One Piece history.

keyEvents.title: Buster Call Bombardment Begins
keyEvents.description: The five Marine battleships begin their bombardment of Ohara, with cannon fire raining down on the island.
keyEvents.significance: The beginning of Ohara's destruction, resulting in the deaths of nearly all the island's inhabitants.

statusHistory.reason: Destroyed by Buster Call ordered by the World Government

description: A massive tree on Ohara that housed the island's extensive library and served as the center of archaeological research. It was specifically targeted during the Buster Call.

keyEvents.title: Clover Reveals Ancient Kingdom Theory
keyEvents.description: Professor Clover reveals to the Five Elders from within the Tree of Knowledge that the Poneglyphs were created by an ancient civilization.
keyEvents.significance: One of the most important Void Century revelations, taking place in the center of Ohara's knowledge.

keyEvents.title: Professor Clover Shot
keyEvents.description: Professor Clover is shot by Spandine inside the Tree of Knowledge before he can reveal the name of the ancient kingdom.
keyEvents.significance: The silencing of Ohara's greatest scholar in the heart of their library.

keyEvents.title: Tree of Knowledge Targeted
keyEvents.description: The scholars realize that the Buster Call's cannon fire is specifically targeting the Tree of Knowledge to destroy all of Ohara's accumulated knowledge.
keyEvents.significance: Represents the World Government's determination to erase not just the scholars, but all knowledge they've accumulated.

keyEvents.title: Scholars Save the Books
keyEvents.description: The scholars throw books from the Tree of Knowledge into the nearby lake to preserve them for future generations.
keyEvents.significance: A desperate attempt to preserve knowledge that would later succeed when Saul and the giants recover these books.

keyEvents.title: Saul Carries Robin Away
keyEvents.description: Saul carries Robin away from the burning Tree of Knowledge as it is consumed by flames.
keyEvents.significance: The final departure from Ohara's center of learning, marking the end of the island's scholarly tradition.

statusHistory.reason: Served as Ohara's library and research center
